info.description: Set of Postman calls for the Data Platform Workshop

exec: console.log("Unable to acquire ACCESS_TOKEN from Adobe IMS to make further calls to Adobe I/O APIs.")
// Do not send HTTP Headers with empty variables, as Postman will send the literal variable name
// Do not send HTTP URL Query Parameters with empty variables, as Postman will send the literal variable name
//Ensure sandbox environment variable is set before continuing
throw new Error("You forgot to update your 'SANDBOX_NAME' environment variable")

header.description: The access token which can be copied from your Experience Platform integration, prefixed with "Bearer". For more information on how to obtain this value, visit the [authentication tutorial](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/experience-platform/tutorials/authentication.html).

The API key which can be copied from your Experience Platform integration, prefixed with "Bearer". For more information on how to obtain this value, visit the [authentication tutorial](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/experience-platform/tutorials/authentication.html).

The access token which can be copied from your Experience Platform integration, prefixed with "Bearer". For more information on how to obtain this value, visit the [authentication tutorial](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/experience-platform/tutorials/authentication.html).

The name of the sandbox in which the operation will take place. See the [sandboxes overview documentation](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/experience-platform/sandbox/home.html) for more information.

request.description: # Call Overview: - Retrieve the current SANDBOX_NAME details - Also confirms the API Project has access to this box ## Response Example: ## Response Analysis: | **variables** | **comments** | | --- | --- | | `name` | This is the SANDBOX_NAME value that is used in the backend | | `title` | This is the friendly name version of the sandbox (will display in the UI and sandbox dropdown) | --- # Lab Task: 1. Click `Send` to execute the call 2. Confirm 200 and sandbox details (should match your seat number) 3. If this sandbox is the wrong seat number, you need to edit your Postman Environment file ## Key Takeaways: - This confirms access to the box and stats/values/details about the sandbox

request.description:
Generate a JWT token using the Crypto RS256
Send to IMS for access_token

header.description: The desired response format (application/vnd.adobe.xed-full+json).

The access token which can be copied from your Experience Platform integration, prefixed with "Bearer ". For more information on how to obtain this value, visit the [authentication tutorial](http://www.adobe.com/go/platform-api-authentication-en).

The API key which can be copied from your Experience Platform integration. For more information on how to obtain this value, visit the [authentication tutorial](http://www.adobe.com/go/platform-api-authentication-en).

The IMS Organization ID which can be copied from your Experience Platform integration. For more information on how to obtain this value, visit the [authentication tutorial](http://www.adobe.com/go/platform-api-authentication-en).
The name of the sandbox in which the operation will take place. See the [sandboxes overview](https://adobe.com/go/sandbox-overview-en) for more information.

request.description:
You are able to view a list of all schemas within a container by performing a single GET request. To help filter results, the Schema Registry supports the use of query parameters when listing resources. The response format postmanends on the `Accept` header sent in the request. The following `Accept` headers are available for this request:
  • `application/vnd.adobe.xed-id+json`: Returns a short summary of each resource, generally the preferred header for listing.
  • `application/vnd.adobe.xed+json`: Returns full JSON for each resource, with the original `$ref` and `allOf` attributes included.

request.description:
The Schema Registry supports all standard JSON Patch operations, including add, remove, and replace, to allow users to modify or update schemas they have defined.


For more information on JSON Patch, including all available operations, read [the official JSON Patch documentation](http://jsonpatch.com).
